name: Indiaâs SII seeks govt intervention over COVID vaccine raw material import from USA
introduction: Shortage of raw materials from the USA could affect the scaling up of production of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine by the Pune-based Serum Institute of India (SII).
content:
Shortage of raw materials from the USA could affect the scaling up of production of the Oxford-AstraZeneca (LSE: AZN) COVID-19 vaccine by the Pune-based Serum Institute of India (SII).

Chief executive Adar Poonawalla spoke at a World Bank panel that a US law is blocking the export of key items that could cause 'serious bottlenecks' in vaccine production.

The Indian vaccines giant has sought the Narendra Modi government's intervention to enable the Institute to import essential raw materials from the US for uninterrupted manufacturing and supply of COVID-19 vaccines.

The SII is producing the vaccine developed by AstraZeneca and Oxford University under its own brand name Covishield and also has agreements with some other developers to produce their vaccines. The SII is the world's largest vaccine manufacturer by volume.


US has invoked Defense Production Act


In a letter to Commerce Secretary Anup Wadhawan and Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla, Prakash Singh, director, government and regulatory affairs at the SII said the US government has invoked the Defense Production Act, because of which the Indian firm is facing difficulties in importing cell culture medias, raw material, and some specialty chemicals from the USA.

Mr Singh further said the SII is working on many other COVID-19 vaccine projects in technical collaboration with various companies, including the USA’s Novavax (Nasdaq: NVAX) and Codagenix, for which it depends on the import of raw materials and components.

The Institute’s chief executive Adar Poonawalla has also gone on record admitting that restrictions on the exports of certain items in the USA was a “serious limiting factor” in scaling up production of COVID-19 vaccines.

At an online discussion, Mr Poonawalla said that, although the SII has been focussing on supplies of vaccine doses via the Gavi’s COVAX facility, for free global access to vaccines it was necessary to get the raw materials out of the USA. He added that though the SII has stockpiled many doses, several constraints were present.
